judgment_metrics.rationale: Core strike quality indicator; directly reflects center contact
Energy transfer efficiency; correlates with smash but adds speed context
CRITICAL for wedge play; maximum spin required for stopping power and trajectory control

diagnostic_metrics.rationale: Informational but not grade-driving; wedges naturally produce steep descent; risk of saturation (all shots near max)
Used for gapping validation and trend monitoring; not grade-driving because distance control intent varies widely
Informational for trajectory assessment; not grade-driving because acceptable range is wide

excluded_metrics.rationale: Speed is outcome, not strike quality; can vary intentionally for distance control
Swing characteristic, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope
Directional control, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope
Swing characteristic, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope

c_definition: C-shot indicates poor contact quality: thin/fat strike (low smash), insufficient spin for stopping power. Wedges demand maximum spin; any spin deficiency is a critical failure.
notes: Wedges prioritize spin above all else. Descent angle is DOWNGRADED to diagnostic because wedges naturally produce steep descent (risk of saturation). Only 3 judgment metrics (smash, ball speed, spin). Spin thresholds will be highest in this class.
